oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A TURBULENT TRANSPORT MODEL OF COASTAL PROCESSES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sheng, Y. Peter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: turbulent transport
transport model
coastal processes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A second-order closure model of turbulent transport and recent model applications to some problems of practical importance in coastal engineering are presented. Particular examples considered are the turbulent wave boundary layer under a linear and a cnoidal wave; current-wave interaction within the bottom boundary layer; mixed layer dynamics; wind-driven currents in a channel. Comparisons are made between the computed results and field/laboratory data.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 160
